messages.subject: re: Talents
messages.msgSnippet: ... I had always thought that this was something that was an inborn trait, along the lines of attached earlobes vs. hangy earlobes, or rolling your rrrrrr s.
messages.messageBody:
>>Meghan (who can also curl her tongue)>>

I had always thought that this was something that was an inborn trait, along
the lines of attached earlobes vs. hangy earlobes, or rolling your rrrrrr's.
Casey and I could always curl our tongues, Conor could not.

BUT, the other day Conor came in and said "Look! I can curl my tongue now."
He had been practicing and sure enough, it was curled. He's been walking
around with his tongue sticking out, all curled up, for a week now. Hmmmm, I
wonder if this will help with his articulation.....<g>

Life is good.
~Mary

_________________________________________________________________

messages.subject: Talents
messages.msgSnippet: ... I can!  Me too! I can also--with a finger from each hand--whistle loudly enough to (unintentionally) hurt your ear and alert
messages.messageBody:
> <<I wish all my friends could sing harmonies by ear>>

I can!

<<I can cross one eye...>>

Me too! I can also--with a finger from each hand--whistle loudly enough
to (unintentionally) hurt your ear and alert someone across an
auditorium.

I can't rrrrrrrrroll my Spanish r's.

Susan
